Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Microbiology \Mi`cro*bi*ol"o*gy\, n. [See {Microbe}; {-logy}.] The branch of biology studying minute organisms, or microbes, such as the bacteria, fungi, viruses, and protozoa. -- {Mi`cro*bi`o*log"ic*al}, a. -- {Mi`cro*bi*ol"o*gist}, n. [Webster 1913 Suppl. +PJC]
microbiology n : the branch of biology that studies microorganisms and their effects on humans
